title: An increase of 8.6% in tourist expenditure and an increase of 3.5% in total inbound visitors in July 2015 compared to July 2014.Travelandtourworld.com
text:
An increase of 8.6% in tourist expenditure and an increase of 3.5% in total inbound visitors in July 2015 compared to July 2014. Published on : Friday, September 4, 2015
Statistics published today by the National Statistics Office show a positive performance in inbound tourism for the month of July 2015. The number of tourists visiting Malta in July 2015 reached 206,626, representing an increase of 4.7% or 9,237 more tourists. Total inbound visitors including cruise passengers spending overnights in Malta amount to 207,541. It is worth noting that the number of tourist nights and expenditure recorded higher growth rates of 7.2% and 8.6% respectively. In comparison to the same month last year, the increase in value exceeds the increase in volume. In July 2015, tourists spent €220.2 million, €17.5 million more than the previous year. Furthermore the average length of stay increased from 8.8 nights in July 2014 to 9.0 nights in July 2015.
Cumulative data for the period January to July 2015 point to a very good performance with the number of inbound tourists increasing by 5.2% over the same period last year. The number of nights stayed by tourists reached 7.3 million, recording an increase of 4.2%. The registered growth rate of tourists staying in private accommodation (+10.2%) is considerably higher than those staying in collective accommodation (+3.6%). Tourist expenditure feature the highest increase of 6.7%, reaching €845.8 million, 52.7 million more over same period last year.
All the major source markets feature increased tourism flows with the exception of Libya, Russia and Scandinavia, registering the expected declines in tourism volumes measured during the period.
The Malta Tourism Authority CEO, Mr Paul Bugeja, commented that “we are pleased with these positive results in particular with the increase in value registered during the month of July and cumulative period January to July. This increase in value is of great benefit to all the tourism players, stakeholders and the overall economic well being of our economy”.
Source:-MTA
